title: Heaviside step function
summary: The Heaviside step function, or the unit step function, usually denoted by H or θ (but sometimes u, 1 or 𝟙), is a step function, named after Oliver Heaviside (1850–1925), the value of which is zero for negative arguments and one for positive arguments.[1] It is an example of the general class of step functions, all of which can be represented as linear combinations of translations of this one.
